title: Understanding Random Errors
text: Random errors are unpredictable variations that occur in measurements. They can arise from various sources, such as environmental changes or instrument fluctuations.

title: Characteristics of Random Errors
text: Unlike systematic errors, random errors do not have a consistent pattern. They can be positive or negative and vary in magnitude.

hintAnswer: An error that varies unpredictably from one measurement to another.
title: Identifying Random Errors
text: Which of the following best describes a random error in measurements?
choices: An error that is consistent in one direction.
An error that varies unpredictably from one measurement to another.
An error that is always positive.
An error that is always negative.
